column5: I am wondering if I can cross the boarder with a propane tank for my fish fryer or not???
Been doing it for 20 years without a problem.
We bring one every year. No problems
I do it at least once a year and never had a problem. The cost of a refill in the states (if you shop around) is half the cost it is in Canada.
I found it cheap to refill in Canada.
I must go to the wrong places. It was $25 cdn where I went last summer and locally here its $13 at the bulk distributor.
Thanks for the help. Last year we took an electric fish fryer and it took a long time to heat up and then get hot again after every batch of fish.
Literally millions of trailers cross the border every year with propane tanks on them, there is no problem.
